meanings.definition: To handle or manage (something) poorly or incorrectly.
meanings.sent1: She kept mishandling the fragile vase, causing it to break.
meanings.sent2: He always mishandles the delicate equipment, leading to frequent malfunctions.
meanings.sent3: The magician's mishandling of the rabbit trick made the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her mishandling of the situation turned a simple issue into a major problem.
meanings.sent5: The student's constant mishandling of the experiment resulted in repeated failures.

meanings.definition: The act of handling or managing (something) poorly or incorrectly.
meanings.sent1: The mishandling of the package resulted in its contents spilling out.
meanings.sent2: The mishandling of funds led to a financial crisis within the company.
meanings.sent3: The mishandling of the cake caused it to collapse before the party.
meanings.sent4: The mishandling of the evidence jeopardized the entire investigation.
meanings.sent5: The mishandling of the fragile artifact resulted in irreparable damage.
